intro: Rosularia libanotica, commonly known as the Lebanon rose. It is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly found in Lebanon and surrounding areas. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent appearance with fleshy, basal leaves that form a rosette. It produces small, pink or white flowers during the spring and summer months. Rosularia libanotica is adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
